param - mosaic parameters
buf - reference to a shared buffer that contains images to be processed
Method Detail

run

public void run()
Creates a mosaic by analyzing the master image, and then getting images from the controller's shared buffer to place in the mosaic. This thread automatically saves the output (this will change).

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable

Returns:

findMatches

public Pixel[][] findMatches(int[][][] avgColors,
                             Pixel[] srcPixels,
                             Parameters param)

Matches up segments in the master image with source images. This is the workhorse of the algorithm. It uses the notion of a score to try to find an acceptable match. Score is calculated as follows:

  • Take the difference between a source image's average red channel, and the segment's average red channel
  • Repeat for green and blue channels
  • Sum the absolute value of these differences

Parameters:
avgColors - a grid of average colors in the master
srcPixels - a set of images to pool from

updateMatches

public void updateMatches(Pixel srcPixels)
This places an image anyplace on the mosaic where it is a better fit than what is already there. This is an incremental version of findMatches.

Parameters:
srcPixels - the image to try and place

Returns:
the average colors of each segment
